Tal'Anee Quests

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Tal'Anee is divided up in to 3 factions which players can align with, two of which provide 3 "apprentice" paths, the third providing a single path. Apprentice paths are a means of handling "newbie quests," by allowing an NPC to draw on a variety of established tasks of appropriate difficulty and value for PCs who have come to them repeatedly for training and assistance. Effectively, a PC completes greater tasks they graduate from Apprentice to Journeyman then Master.

Warrior

Factions

Por'Taem

Recruit - Guard - Guard Captain

Skills; Sword, Armor Proficiency, Block

Far'Maen

Irregular - Militiaman - Guard

Skills: Axe (one and two handed), Parry

Bandits

Rogue - Scout - Bandit

Skills: Blunt (one and two handed), Dodge

Example Quests

Most warrior quests fall into the traditional "find and kill" pattern. Making rounds and checking in at various outposts also fall into this mold.

Merchant

(both Por'Taem and Far'Maen) Clerk - Trader - Merchant

Skills; Merchant

Example Quests

Generally, merchant quests are a lot of "fetch this, get that." Clerks should only leave the home town when close to Traders, while a Trader may well be asked to travel between the two towns (assuming they haven't done something to particularly damage their standing with the other town).

Priest

Initiate - Acolyte - Priest

Factions

Por'Taem

Skills; Sage, Teacher, Healer, and Fisher

Far'Maen

Skills; Bard, Teacher, Healer, and Farmer

Example Quests

Priest quests are by far the most varied, ranging from supplications or sacrifices being performed at specific times and places, or obtaining particular relics which may have been lost.
